meanings.definition: An underground tunnel for irrigation in arid regions.
meanings.sent1: The villagers relied on the qanat to bring water to their crops.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization built a qanat to ensure their fields stayed fertile.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids played hide-and-seek in the dark qanat, pretending it was a secret tunnel.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a qanat of ideas, flowing endlessly with creativity.
meanings.sent5: The qanat whispered tales of ancient times as the water trickled through the underground passage.

meanings.definition: A system of wells connected by underground channels for transporting water.
meanings.sent1: The qanat network efficiently distributed water across the desert landscape.
meanings.sent2: Farmers in the region collaborated to maintain the intricate qanat system.
meanings.sent3: The explorer marveled at the engineering marvel of the qanat, comparing it to a hidden aqueduct.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a qanat, connecting them through unseen depths.
meanings.sent5: The qanat hummed with life as water flowed silently through its subterranean passages.
